title: Death railway (Captioned)
viewing_guidelines: CAPTIONED: suitable for hearing impaired viewers
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Prisoners of war
description: Death Railway, portrays the heroism and solidarity of the Australian troops during World War 11. Using scenes of the railway today, authentic archival footage from Australian and Japanese sources, the drawings of Sir Edward Dunlop, and present day interviews, the film covers the route the railway took up the Kwai Noi Valley, between Rangoon and Bangkok. 116,000 Australians, British and Dutch lost their lives building the railway.
